intro: Tephrosia huillensis var. grandiflora, commonly known as the Huillén grandiflora, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and often nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves and produces showy, pea-like flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in montane forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
